00062 #define NUMPRINTCOLUMNS 32      /* # columns of data to print on each line */
00063 
00064 /*
00065  * Each test run will work with one or more separate file descriptors for the
00066  * same file.  This allows testing cache coherency across multiple mountpoints
00067  * of the same network filesystem on a single client.
00068  */
00069 struct test_file {
00070         char *path;
00071         int fd;
00072 } *test_files = NULL;
00073 
00074 int num_test_files;
00075 enum fd_iteration_policy {
00076         FD_SINGLE,
00077         FD_ROTATE,
00078         FD_RANDOM,
00079 };
00080 int fd_policy = FD_RANDOM;
00081 int fd_last;
00082 
00083 /*
00084  *      A log entry is an operation and a bunch of arguments.
00085  */
00086 
00087 struct log_entry {
00088         int                     operation;
00089         int                     args[3];
00090         struct timeval          tv;
00091         const struct test_file  *tf;
00092 };
00093 
00094 #define LOGSIZE 100000
00095 
00096 struct log_entry        oplog[LOGSIZE]; /* the log */
00097 int                     logptr = 0;     /* current position in log */
00098 int                     logcount = 0;   /* total ops */
00099 
00100 /*
00101  *      Define operations
00102  */
00103 
00104 #define OP_READ         1
00105 #define OP_WRITE        2
00106 #define OP_TRUNCATE     3
00107 #define OP_CLOSEOPEN    4
00108 #define OP_MAPREAD      5
00109 #define OP_MAPWRITE     6
00110 #define OP_SKIPPED      7
00111 
00112 int page_size;
00113 int page_mask;
00114 
00115 char    *original_buf;                  /* a pointer to the original data */
00116 char    *good_buf;                      /* a pointer to the correct data */
00117 char    *temp_buf;                      /* a pointer to the current data */
00118 char    *fname;                         /* name of our test file */
00119 char    logfile[1024];                  /* name of our log file */
00120 char    goodfile[1024];                 /* name of our test file */
00121 
00122 off_t           file_size = 0;
00123 off_t           biggest = 0;
00124 char            state[256];
00125 unsigned long   testcalls = 0;          /* calls to function "test" */
00126 
00127 long    simulatedopcount = 0;           /* -b flag */
00128 int     closeprob = 0;                  /* -c flag */
00129 int     debug = 0;                      /* -d flag */
00130 long    debugstart = 0;                 /* -D flag */
00131 long    maxfilelen = 256 * 1024;        /* -l flag */
00132 int     sizechecks = 1;                 /* -n flag disables them */
00133 int     maxoplen = 64 * 1024;           /* -o flag */
00134 int     quiet = 0;                      /* -q flag */
00135 long    progressinterval = 0;           /* -p flag */
00136 int     readbdy = 1;                    /* -r flag */
00137 int     style = 0;                      /* -s flag */
00138 int     truncbdy = 1;                   /* -t flag */
00139 int     writebdy = 1;                   /* -w flag */
00140 long    monitorstart = -1;              /* -m flag */
00141 long    monitorend = -1;                /* -m flag */
00142 int     lite = 0;                       /* -L flag */
00143 long    numops = -1;                    /* -N flag */
00144 int     randomoplen = 1;                /* -O flag disables it */
00145 int     seed = 1;                       /* -S flag */
00146 int     mapped_writes = 1;              /* -W flag disables */
00147 int     mapped_reads = 1;               /* -R flag disables it */
00148 int     fsxgoodfd = 0;
00149 FILE *  fsxlogf = NULL;
00150 int badoff = -1;

00152 
00153 void
00154 vwarnc(code, fmt, ap)
00155         int code;
00156         const char *fmt;
00157         va_list ap;
00158 {
00159         fprintf(stderr, "fsx: ");
00160         if (fmt != NULL) {
00161                 vfprintf(stderr, fmt, ap);
00162                 fprintf(stderr, ": ");
00163         }
00164         fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", strerror(code));
00165 }
00166 
00167 
00168 void
00169 warn(const char * fmt, ...)
00170 {
00171         va_list ap;
00172         va_start(ap, fmt);
00173         vwarnc(errno, fmt, ap);
00174         va_end(ap);
00175 }
00176 
00177 
00178 void
00179 __attribute__((format(printf, 1, 2)))
00180 prt(char *fmt, ...)
00181 {
00182         va_list args;
00183 
00184         va_start(args, fmt);
00185         vfprintf(stdout, fmt, args);
00186         va_end(args);
00187 
00188         if (fsxlogf) {
00189                 va_start(args, fmt);
00190                 vfprintf(fsxlogf, fmt, args);
00191                 va_end(args);
00192         }
00193 }
00194 
00195 void
00196 prterr(char *prefix)
00197 {
00198         prt("%s%s%s\n", prefix, prefix ? ": " : "", strerror(errno));
00199 }
00200 
00201 
00202 void
00203 log4(int operation, int arg0, int arg1, int arg2, struct timeval *tv,
00204         const struct test_file *tf)
00205 {
00206         struct log_entry *le;
00207 
00208         le = &oplog[logptr];
00209         le->operation = operation;
00210         le->args[0] = arg0;
00211         le->args[1] = arg1;
00212         le->args[2] = arg2;
00213         le->tv = *tv;
00214         le->tf = tf;
00215         logptr++;
00216         logcount++;
00217         if (logptr >= LOGSIZE)
00218                 logptr = 0;
00219 }
00220 
00221 const char *
00222 fill_tf_buf(const struct test_file *tf)
00223 {
00224         static int max_tf_len;
00225         static char tf_buf[32];
00226 
00227         if (fd_policy == FD_SINGLE)
00228                 return "";
00229 
00230         if (max_tf_len == 0)
00231                 max_tf_len = snprintf(tf_buf, sizeof(tf_buf) - 1,
00232                                       "%u", num_test_files - 1);
00233 
00234         sprintf(tf_buf, "[%0*lu]", max_tf_len,
00235                 (unsigned long)(tf - test_files));
00236 
00237         return tf_buf;
00238 }
00239 
00240 void
00241 logdump(void)
00242 {
00243         int     i, count, down;
00244         struct log_entry        *lp;
00245 
00246         prt("LOG DUMP (%d total operations):\n", logcount);
00247         if (logcount < LOGSIZE) {
00248                 i = 0;
00249                 count = logcount;
00250         } else {
00251                 i = logptr;
00252                 count = LOGSIZE;
00253         }
00254         for ( ; count > 0; count--) {
00255                 int opnum;
00256 
00257                 opnum = i+1 + (logcount/LOGSIZE)*LOGSIZE;
00258                 lp = &oplog[i];
00259                 prt("%d%s: %lu.%06lu ", opnum, fill_tf_buf(lp->tf),
00260                     lp->tv.tv_sec, lp->tv.tv_usec);
00261 
00262                 switch (lp->operation) {
00263                 case OP_MAPREAD:
00264                         prt("MAPREAD  0x%x thru 0x%x (0x%x bytes)",
00265                             lp->args[0], lp->args[0] + lp->args[1] - 1,
00266                             lp->args[1]);
00267                         if (badoff >= lp->args[0] && badoff <
00268                                                      lp->args[0] + lp->args[1])
00269                                 prt("\t***RRRR***");
00270                         break;
00271                 case OP_MAPWRITE:
00272                         prt("MAPWRITE 0x%x thru 0x%x (0x%x bytes)",
00273                             lp->args[0], lp->args[0] + lp->args[1] - 1,
00274                             lp->args[1]);
00275                         if (badoff >= lp->args[0] && badoff <
00276                                                      lp->args[0] + lp->args[1])
00277                                 prt("\t******WWWW");
00278                         break;
00279                 case OP_READ:
00280                         prt("READ     0x%x thru 0x%x (0x%x bytes)",
00281                             lp->args[0], lp->args[0] + lp->args[1] - 1,
00282                             lp->args[1]);
00283                         if (badoff >= lp->args[0] &&
00284                             badoff < lp->args[0] + lp->args[1])
00285                                 prt("\t***RRRR***");
00286                         break;
00287                 case OP_WRITE:
00288                         prt("WRITE    0x%x thru 0x%x (0x%x bytes)",
00289                             lp->args[0], lp->args[0] + lp->args[1] - 1,
00290                             lp->args[1]);
00291                         if (lp->args[0] > lp->args[2])
00292                                 prt(" HOLE");
00293                         else if (lp->args[0] + lp->args[1] > lp->args[2])
00294                                 prt(" EXTEND");
00295                         if ((badoff >= lp->args[0] || badoff >=lp->args[2]) &&
00296                             badoff < lp->args[0] + lp->args[1])
00297                                 prt("\t***WWWW");
00298                         break;
00299                 case OP_TRUNCATE:
00300                         down = lp->args[0] < lp->args[1];
00301                         prt("TRUNCATE %s\tfrom 0x%x to 0x%x",
00302                             down ? "DOWN" : "UP", lp->args[1], lp->args[0]);
00303                         if (badoff >= lp->args[!down] &&
00304                             badoff < lp->args[!!down])
00305                                 prt("\t******WWWW");
00306                         break;
00307                 case OP_CLOSEOPEN:
00308                         prt("CLOSE/OPEN");
00309                         break;
00310                 case OP_SKIPPED:
00311                         prt("SKIPPED (no operation)");
00312                         break;
00313                 default:
00314                         prt("BOGUS LOG ENTRY (operation code = %d)!",
00315                             lp->operation);
00316                 }
00317                 prt("\n");
00318                 i++;
00319                 if (i == LOGSIZE)
00320                         i = 0;
00321         }
00322 }
00323 
00324 
00325 void
00326 save_buffer(char *buffer, off_t bufferlength, int fd)
00327 {
00328         off_t ret;
00329         ssize_t byteswritten;
00330 
00331         if (fd <= 0 || bufferlength == 0)
00332                 return;
00333 
00334         if (bufferlength > SSIZE_MAX) {
00335                 prt("fsx flaw: overflow in save_buffer\n");
00336                 exit(67);
00337         }
00338         if (lite) {
00339                 off_t size_by_seek = lseek(fd, (off_t)0, SEEK_END);
00340                 if (size_by_seek == (off_t)-1)
00341                         prterr("save_buffer: lseek eof");
00342                 else if (bufferlength > size_by_seek) {
00343                         warn("save_buffer: .fsxgood file too short... will"
00344                                 "save 0x%llx bytes instead of 0x%llx\n",
00345                                 (unsigned long long)size_by_seek,
00346                                 (unsigned long long)bufferlength);
00347                         bufferlength = size_by_seek;
00348                 }
00349         }
00350 
00351         ret = lseek(fd, (off_t)0, SEEK_SET);
00352         if (ret == (off_t)-1)
00353                 prterr("save_buffer: lseek 0");
00354 
00355         byteswritten = write(fd, buffer, (size_t)bufferlength);
00356         if (byteswritten != bufferlength) {
00357                 if (byteswritten == -1)
00358                         prterr("save_buffer write");
00359                 else
00360                         warn("save_buffer: short write, 0x%x bytes instead"
00361                                 "of 0x%llx\n",
00362                              (unsigned)byteswritten,
00363                              (unsigned long long)bufferlength);
00364         }
00365 }
00366 
00367 
00368 void
00369 report_failure(int status)
00370 {
00371         logdump();
00372 
00373         if (fsxgoodfd) {
00374                 if (good_buf) {
00375                         save_buffer(good_buf, file_size, fsxgoodfd);
00376                         prt("Correct content saved for comparison\n");
00377                         prt("(maybe hexdump \"%s\" vs \"%s\")\n",
00378                             fname, goodfile);
00379                 }
00380                 close(fsxgoodfd);
00381         }
00382         exit(status);
00383 }
00384 
00385 
00386 #define short_at(cp) ((unsigned short)((*((unsigned char *)(cp)) << 8) | \
00387                                         *(((unsigned char *)(cp)) + 1)))
00388 
00389 void
00390 check_buffers(unsigned offset, unsigned size)
00391 {
00392         unsigned char c, t;
00393         unsigned i = 0;
00394         unsigned n = 0;
00395         unsigned op = 0;
00396         unsigned bad = 0;
00397 
00398         if (memcmp(good_buf + offset, temp_buf, size) != 0) {
00399                 prt("READ BAD DATA: offset = 0x%x, size = 0x%x\n",
00400                     offset, size);
00401                 prt("OFFSET\tGOOD\tBAD\tRANGE\n");
00402                 while (size > 0) {
00403                         c = good_buf[offset];
00404                         t = temp_buf[i];
00405                         if (c != t) {
00406                                 if (n == 0) {
00407                                         bad = short_at(&temp_buf[i]);
00408                                         prt("%#07x\t%#06x\t%#06x", offset,
00409                                             short_at(&good_buf[offset]), bad);
00410                                         op = temp_buf[offset & 1 ? i+1 : i];
00411                                 }
00412                                 n++;
00413                                 badoff = offset;
00414                         }
00415                         offset++;
00416                         i++;
00417                         size--;
00418                 }
00419                 if (n) {
00420                         prt("\t%#7x\n", n);
00421                         if (bad)
00422                                 prt("operation# (mod 256) for the bad data"
00423                                         "may be %u\n", ((unsigned)op & 0xff));
00424                         else
00425                                 prt("operation# (mod 256) for the bad data"
00426                                         "unknown, check HOLE and EXTEND ops\n");
00427                 } else
00428                         prt("????????????????\n");
00429                 report_failure(110);
00430         }
00431 }
00432 
00433 struct test_file *
00434 get_tf(void)
00435 {
00436         unsigned index = 0;
00437 
00438         switch (fd_policy) {
00439                 case FD_ROTATE:
00440                         index = fd_last++;
00441                         break;
00442                 case FD_RANDOM:
00443                         index = random();
00444                         break;
00445                 case FD_SINGLE:
00446                         index = 0;
00447                         break;
00448                 default:
00449                         prt("unknown policy");
00450                         exit(1);
00451                         break;
00452         }
00453         return &test_files[ index % num_test_files ];
00454 }
00455 
00456 void
00457 assign_fd_policy(char *policy)
00458 {
00459         if (!strcmp(policy, "random"))
00460                 fd_policy = FD_RANDOM;
00461         else if (!strcmp(policy, "rotate"))
00462                 fd_policy = FD_ROTATE;
00463         else {
00464                 prt("unknown -I policy: '%s'\n", policy);
00465                 exit(1);
00466         }
00467 }
00468 
00469 int
00470 get_fd(void)
00471 {
00472         struct test_file *tf = get_tf();
00473         return tf->fd;
00474 }
00475 
00476 static const char *my_basename(const char *path)
00477 {
00478         char *c = strrchr(path, '/');
00479 
00480         return c ? c++ : path;
00481 }
00482 
00483 void
00484 open_test_files(char **argv, int argc)
00485 {
00486         struct test_file *tf;
00487         int i;
00488 
00489         num_test_files = argc;
00490         if (num_test_files == 1)
00491                 fd_policy = FD_SINGLE;
00492 
00493         test_files = calloc(num_test_files, sizeof(*test_files));
00494         if (test_files == NULL) {
00495                 prterr("reallocating space for test files");
00496                 exit(1);
00497         }
00498 
00499         for (i = 0, tf = test_files; i < num_test_files; i++, tf++) {
00500 
00501                 tf->path = argv[i];
00502                 tf->fd = open(tf->path, O_RDWR|(lite ? 0 : O_CREAT|O_TRUNC),
00503                                 0666);
00504                 if (tf->fd < 0) {
00505                         prterr(tf->path);
00506                         exit(91);
00507                 }
00508         }
00509 
00510         if (quiet || fd_policy == FD_SINGLE)
00511                 return;
00512 
00513         for (i = 0, tf = test_files; i < num_test_files; i++, tf++)
00514                 prt("fd %d: %s\n", i, tf->path);
00515 }
00516 
00517 void
00518 close_test_files(void)
00519 {
00520         int i;
00521         struct test_file *tf;
00522 
00523         for (i = 0, tf = test_files; i < num_test_files; i++, tf++) {
00524                 if (close(tf->fd)) {
00525                         prterr("close");
00526                         report_failure(99);
00527                 }
00528         }
00529 }
00530 
00531 
00532 void
00533 check_size(void)
00534 {
00535         struct stat     statbuf;
00536         off_t   size_by_seek;
00537         int fd = get_fd();
00538 
00539         if (fstat(fd, &statbuf)) {
00540                 prterr("check_size: fstat");
00541                 statbuf.st_size = -1;
00542         }
00543         size_by_seek = lseek(fd, (off_t)0, SEEK_END);
00544         if (file_size != statbuf.st_size || file_size != size_by_seek) {
00545                 prt("Size error: expected 0x%llx stat 0x%llx seek 0x%llx\n",
00546                     (unsigned long long)file_size,
00547                     (unsigned long long)statbuf.st_size,
00548                     (unsigned long long)size_by_seek);
00549                 report_failure(120);
00550         }
00551 }
00552 
00553 
00554 void
00555 check_trunc_hack(void)
00556 {
00557         struct stat statbuf;
00558         int fd = get_fd();
00559 
00560         /* should not ignore ftruncate(2)'s return value */
00561         if (ftruncate(fd, (off_t)0) < 0) {
00562                 prterr("trunc_hack: ftruncate(0)");
00563                 exit(1);
00564         }
00565         if (ftruncate(fd, (off_t)100000) < 0) {
00566                 prterr("trunc_hack: ftruncate(100000)");
00567                 exit(1);
00568         }
00569         if (fstat(fd, &statbuf)) {
00570                 prterr("trunc_hack: fstat");
00571                 statbuf.st_size = -1;
00572         }
00573         if (statbuf.st_size != (off_t)100000) {
00574                 prt("no extend on truncate! not posix!\n");
00575                 exit(130);
00576         }
00577         if (ftruncate(fd, 0) < 0) {
00578                 prterr("trunc_hack: ftruncate(0) (2nd call)");
00579                 exit(1);
00580         }
00581 }
00582 
00583 void
00584 output_line(struct test_file *tf, int op, unsigned offset,
00585                 unsigned size, struct timeval *tv)
00586 {
00587         char *ops[] = {
00588                 [OP_READ] = "read",
00589                 [OP_WRITE] = "write",
00590                 [OP_TRUNCATE] = "trunc from",
00591                 [OP_MAPREAD] = "mapread",
00592                 [OP_MAPWRITE] = "mapwrite",
00593         };
00594 
00595         /* W. */
00596         if (!(!quiet && ((progressinterval &&
00597                         testcalls % progressinterval == 0) ||
00598                        (debug &&
00599                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00600                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00601                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend)))))))
00602                 return;
00603 
00604         prt("%06lu%s %lu.%06lu %-10s %#08x %s %#08x\t(0x%x bytes)\n",
00605                 testcalls, fill_tf_buf(tf), tv->tv_sec, tv->tv_usec,
00606                 ops[op],
00607                 offset, op == OP_TRUNCATE ? " to " : "thru",
00608                 offset + size - 1, size);
00609 }
00610 
00611 void
00612 doread(unsigned offset, unsigned size)
00613 {
00614         struct timeval t;
00615         off_t ret;
00616         unsigned iret;
00617         struct test_file *tf = get_tf();
00618         int fd = tf->fd;
00619 
00620         offset -= offset % readbdy;
00621         gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00622         if (size == 0) {
00623                 if (!quiet && testcalls > simulatedopcount)
00624                         prt("skipping zero size read\n");
00625                 log4(OP_SKIPPED, OP_READ, offset, size, &t, tf);
00626                 return;
00627         }
00628         if (size + offset > file_size) {
00629                 if (!quiet && testcalls > simulatedopcount)
00630                         prt("skipping seek/read past end of file\n");
00631                 log4(OP_SKIPPED, OP_READ, offset, size, &t, tf);
00632                 return;
00633         }
00634 
00635         log4(OP_READ, offset, size, 0, &t, tf);
00636 
00637         if (testcalls <= simulatedopcount)
00638                 return;
00639 
00640         output_line(tf, OP_READ, offset, size, &t);
00641 
00642         ret = lseek(fd, (off_t)offset, SEEK_SET);
00643         if (ret == (off_t)-1) {
00644                 prterr("doread: lseek");
00645                 report_failure(140);
00646         }
00647         iret = read(fd, temp_buf, size);
00648         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00649                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00650                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00651                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00652                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00653                 prt("       %lu.%06lu read done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00654         }
00655         if (iret != size) {
00656                 if (iret == -1)
00657                         prterr("doread: read");
00658                 else
00659                         prt("short read: 0x%x bytes instead of 0x%x\n",
00660                             iret, size);
00661                 report_failure(141);
00662         }
00663         check_buffers(offset, size);
00664 }
00665 
00666 
00667 void
00668 domapread(unsigned offset, unsigned size)
00669 {
00670         struct timeval t;
00671         unsigned pg_offset;
00672         unsigned map_size;
00673         char    *p;
00674         struct test_file *tf = get_tf();
00675         int fd = tf->fd;
00676 
00677         offset -= offset % readbdy;
00678         gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00679         if (size == 0) {
00680                 if (!quiet && testcalls > simulatedopcount)
00681                         prt("skipping zero size read\n");
00682                 log4(OP_SKIPPED, OP_MAPREAD, offset, size, &t, tf);
00683                 return;
00684         }
00685         if (size + offset > file_size) {
00686                 if (!quiet && testcalls > simulatedopcount)
00687                         prt("skipping seek/read past end of file\n");
00688                 log4(OP_SKIPPED, OP_MAPREAD, offset, size, &t, tf);
00689                 return;
00690         }
00691 
00692         log4(OP_MAPREAD, offset, size, 0, &t, tf);
00693 
00694         if (testcalls <= simulatedopcount)
00695                 return;
00696 
00697         output_line(tf, OP_MAPREAD, offset, size, &t);
00698 
00699         pg_offset = offset & page_mask;
00700         map_size  = pg_offset + size;
00701 
00702         if ((p = mmap(0, map_size, PROT_READ, MAP_FILE | MAP_SHARED, fd,
00703                       (off_t)(offset - pg_offset))) == MAP_FAILED) {
00704                 prterr("domapread: mmap");
00705                 report_failure(190);
00706         }
00707         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00708                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00709                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00710                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00711                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00712                 prt("       %lu.%06lu mmap done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00713         }
00714         memcpy(temp_buf, p + pg_offset, size);
00715         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00716                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00717                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00718                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00719                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00720                 prt("       %lu.%06lu memcpy done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00721         }
00722         if (munmap(p, map_size) != 0) {
00723                 prterr("domapread: munmap");
00724                 report_failure(191);
00725         }
00726         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00727                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00728                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00729                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00730                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00731                 prt("       %lu.%06lu munmap done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00732         }
00733 
00734         check_buffers(offset, size);
00735 }
00736 
00737 
00738 void
00739 gendata(char *original_buf, char *good_buf, unsigned offset, unsigned size)
00740 {
00741         while (size--) {
00742                 good_buf[offset] = testcalls % 256;
00743                 if (offset % 2)
00744                         good_buf[offset] += original_buf[offset];
00745                 offset++;
00746         }
00747 }
00748 
00749 
00750 void
00751 dowrite(unsigned offset, unsigned size)
00752 {
00753         struct timeval t;
00754         off_t ret;
00755         unsigned iret;
00756         struct test_file *tf = get_tf();
00757         int fd = tf->fd;
00758 
00759         offset -= offset % writebdy;
00760         gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00761         if (size == 0) {
00762                 if (!quiet && testcalls > simulatedopcount)
00763                         prt("skipping zero size write\n");
00764                 log4(OP_SKIPPED, OP_WRITE, offset, size, &t, tf);
00765                 return;
00766         }
00767 
00768         log4(OP_WRITE, offset, size, file_size, &t, tf);
00769 
00770         gendata(original_buf, good_buf, offset, size);
00771         if (file_size < offset + size) {
00772                 if (file_size < offset)
00773                         memset(good_buf + file_size, '\0', offset - file_size);
00774                 file_size = offset + size;
00775                 if (lite) {
00776                         warn("Lite file size bug in fsx!");
00777                         report_failure(149);
00778                 }
00779         }
00780 
00781         if (testcalls <= simulatedopcount)
00782                 return;
00783 
00784         output_line(tf, OP_WRITE, offset, size, &t);
00785 
00786         ret = lseek(fd, (off_t)offset, SEEK_SET);
00787         if (ret == (off_t)-1) {
00788                 prterr("dowrite: lseek");
00789                 report_failure(150);
00790         }
00791         iret = write(fd, good_buf + offset, size);
00792         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00793                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00794                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00795                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00796                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00797                 prt("       %lu.%06lu write done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00798         }
00799         if (iret != size) {
00800                 if (iret == -1)
00801                         prterr("dowrite: write");
00802                 else
00803                         prt("short write: 0x%x bytes instead of 0x%x\n",
00804                             iret, size);
00805                 report_failure(151);
00806         }
00807 }
00808 
00809 
00810 void
00811 domapwrite(unsigned offset, unsigned size)
00812 {
00813         struct timeval t;
00814         unsigned pg_offset;
00815         unsigned map_size;
00816         off_t    cur_filesize;
00817         char    *p;
00818         struct test_file *tf = get_tf();
00819         int fd = tf->fd;
00820 
00821         offset -= offset % writebdy;
00822         gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00823         if (size == 0) {
00824                 if (!quiet && testcalls > simulatedopcount)
00825                         prt("skipping zero size write\n");
00826                 log4(OP_SKIPPED, OP_MAPWRITE, offset, size, &t, tf);
00827                 return;
00828         }
00829         cur_filesize = file_size;
00830 
00831         log4(OP_MAPWRITE, offset, size, 0, &t, tf);
00832 
00833         gendata(original_buf, good_buf, offset, size);
00834         if (file_size < offset + size) {
00835                 if (file_size < offset)
00836                         memset(good_buf + file_size, '\0', offset - file_size);
00837                 file_size = offset + size;
00838                 if (lite) {
00839                         warn("Lite file size bug in fsx!");
00840                         report_failure(200);
00841                 }
00842         }
00843 
00844         if (testcalls <= simulatedopcount)
00845                 return;
00846 
00847         output_line(tf, OP_MAPWRITE, offset, size, &t);
00848 
00849         if (file_size > cur_filesize) {
00850                 if (ftruncate(fd, file_size) == -1) {
00851                         prterr("domapwrite: ftruncate");
00852                         exit(201);
00853                 }
00854                 if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00855                                (monitorstart == -1 ||
00856                                 (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00857                                  (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00858                         gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00859                         prt("       %lu.%06lu truncate done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00860         }
00861         }
00862         pg_offset = offset & page_mask;
00863         map_size  = pg_offset + size;
00864 
00865         if ((p = mmap(0, map_size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_FILE|MAP_SHARED,
00866                       fd, (off_t)(offset - pg_offset))) == MAP_FAILED) {
00867                 prterr("domapwrite: mmap");
00868                 report_failure(202);
00869         }
00870         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00871                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00872                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00873                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00874                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00875                 prt("       %lu.%06lu mmap done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00876         }
00877         memcpy(p + pg_offset, good_buf + offset, size);
00878         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00879                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00880                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00881                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00882                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00883                 prt("       %lu.%06lu memcpy done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00884         }
00885         if (msync(p, map_size, 0) != 0) {
00886                 prterr("domapwrite: msync");
00887                 report_failure(203);
00888         }
00889         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00890                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00891                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00892                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00893                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00894                 prt("       %lu.%06lu msync done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00895         }
00896         if (munmap(p, map_size) != 0) {
00897                 prterr("domapwrite: munmap");
00898                 report_failure(204);
00899         }
00900         if (!quiet && (debug > 1 &&
00901                         (monitorstart == -1 ||
00902                          (offset + size > monitorstart &&
00903                           (monitorend == -1 || offset <= monitorend))))) {
00904                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00905                 prt("       %lu.%06lu munmap done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00906         }
00907 }
00908 
00909 
00910 void
00911 dotruncate(unsigned size)
00912 {
00913         struct timeval t;
00914         int oldsize = file_size;
00915         struct test_file *tf = get_tf();
00916         int fd = tf->fd;
00917 
00918         size -= size % truncbdy;
00919         gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00920         if (size > biggest) {
00921                 biggest = size;
00922                 if (!quiet && testcalls > simulatedopcount)
00923                         prt("truncating to largest ever: 0x%x\n", size);
00924         }
00925 
00926         log4(OP_TRUNCATE, size, (unsigned)file_size, 0, &t, tf);
00927 
00928         if (size > file_size)
00929                 memset(good_buf + file_size, '\0', size - file_size);
00930         file_size = size;
00931 
00932         if (testcalls <= simulatedopcount)
00933                 return;
00934 
00935         output_line(tf, OP_TRUNCATE, oldsize, size, &t);
00936 
00937         if (ftruncate(fd, (off_t)size) == -1) {
00938                 prt("ftruncate1: %x\n", size);
00939                 prterr("dotruncate: ftruncate");
00940                 report_failure(160);
00941         }
00942         if (!quiet && debug > 1) {
00943                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00944                 prt("       %lu.%06lu trunc done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00945         }
00946 }
00947 
00948 
00949 void
00950 writefileimage()
00951 {
00952         ssize_t iret;
00953         int fd = get_fd();
00954 
00955         if (lseek(fd, (off_t)0, SEEK_SET) == (off_t)-1) {
00956                 prterr("writefileimage: lseek");
00957                 report_failure(171);
00958         }
00959         iret = write(fd, good_buf, file_size);
00960         if ((off_t)iret != file_size) {
00961                 if (iret == -1)
00962                         prterr("writefileimage: write");
00963                 else
00964                         prt("short write: 0x%lx bytes instead of 0x%llx\n",
00965                             (unsigned long)iret,
00966                             (unsigned long long)file_size);
00967                 report_failure(172);
00968         }
00969         if (lite ? 0 : ftruncate(fd, file_size) == -1) {
00970                 prt("ftruncate2: %llx\n", (unsigned long long)file_size);
00971                 prterr("writefileimage: ftruncate");
00972                 report_failure(173);
00973         }
00974 }
00975 
00976 
00977 void
00978 docloseopen(void)
00979 {
00980         struct timeval t;
00981         struct test_file *tf = get_tf();
00982 
00983         if (testcalls <= simulatedopcount)
00984                 return;
00985 
00986         gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00987         log4(OP_CLOSEOPEN, file_size, (unsigned)file_size, 0, &t, tf);
00988 
00989         if (debug)
00990                 prt("%06lu %lu.%06lu close/open\n", testcalls, t.tv_sec,
00991                     t.tv_usec);
00992         if (close(tf->fd)) {
00993                 prterr("docloseopen: close");
00994                 report_failure(180);
00995         }
00996         if (!quiet && debug > 1) {
00997                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00998                 prt("       %lu.%06lu close done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
00999         }
01000         tf->fd = open(tf->path, O_RDWR, 0);
01001         if (tf->fd < 0) {
01002                 prterr("docloseopen: open");
01003                 report_failure(181);
01004         }
01005         if (!quiet && debug > 1) {
01006                 gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
01007                 prt("       %lu.%06lu open done\n", t.tv_sec, t.tv_usec);
01008         }
01009 }
01010 
01011 
01012 void
01013 test(void)
01014 {
01015         unsigned long   offset;
01016         unsigned long   size = maxoplen;
01017         unsigned long   rv = random();
01018         unsigned long   op = rv % (3 + !lite + mapped_writes);
01019 
01020         /* turn off the map read if necessary */
01021 
01022         if (op == 2 && !mapped_reads)
01023             op = 0;
01024 
01025         if (simulatedopcount > 0 && testcalls == simulatedopcount)
01026                 writefileimage();
01027 
01028         testcalls++;
01029 
01030         if (debugstart > 0 && testcalls >= debugstart)
01031                 debug = 1;
01032 
01033         if (!quiet && testcalls < simulatedopcount && testcalls % 100000 == 0)
01034                 prt("%lu...\n", testcalls);
01035 
01036         /*
01037          * READ:        op = 0
01038          * WRITE:       op = 1
01039          * MAPREAD:     op = 2
01040          * TRUNCATE:    op = 3
01041          * MAPWRITE:    op = 3 or 4
01042          */
01043         if (lite ? 0 : op == 3 && (style & 1) == 0) /* vanilla truncate? */
01044                 dotruncate(random() % maxfilelen);
01045         else {
01046                 if (randomoplen)
01047                         size = random() % (maxoplen+1);
01048                 if (lite ? 0 : op == 3)
01049                         dotruncate(size);
01050                 else {
01051                         offset = random();
01052                         if (op == 1 || op == (lite ? 3 : 4)) {
01053                                 offset %= maxfilelen;
01054                                 if (offset + size > maxfilelen)
01055                                         size = maxfilelen - offset;
01056                                 if (op != 1)
01057                                         domapwrite(offset, size);
01058                                 else
01059                                         dowrite(offset, size);
01060                         } else {
01061                                 if (file_size)
01062                                         offset %= file_size;
01063                                 else
01064                                         offset = 0;
01065                                 if (offset + size > file_size)
01066                                         size = file_size - offset;
01067                                 if (op != 0)
01068                                         domapread(offset, size);
01069                                 else
01070                                         doread(offset, size);
01071                         }
01072                 }
01073         }
01074         if (sizechecks && testcalls > simulatedopcount)
01075                 check_size();
01076         if (closeprob && (rv >> 3) < (1 << 28) / closeprob)
01077                 docloseopen();
01078 }
01079 
01080 
01081 void
01082 cleanup(sig)
01083         int     sig;
01084 {
01085         if (sig)
01086                 prt("signal %d\n", sig);
01087         prt("testcalls = %lu\n", testcalls);
01088         exit(sig);
01089 }
01090 
01091 
01092 void
01093 usage(void)
01094 {
01095         fprintf(stdout, "usage: %s",
01096                 "fsx [-dnqLOW] [-b opnum] [-c Prob] [-l flen] [-m "
01097 "start:end] [-o oplen] [-p progressinterval] [-r readbdy] [-s style] [-t "
01098 "truncbdy] [-w writebdy] [-D startingop] [-N numops] [-P dirpath] [-S seed] "
01099 "[ -I random|rotate ] fname [additional paths to fname..]\n"
01100 "       -b opnum: beginning operation number (default 1)\n"
01101 "       -c P: 1 in P chance of file close+open at each op (default infinity)\n"
01102 "       -d: debug output for all operations [-d -d = more debugging]\n"
01103 "       -l flen: the upper bound on file size (default 262144)\n"
01104 "       -m startop:endop: monitor (print debug output) specified byte rang"
01105 "(default 0:infinity)\n"
01106 "       -n: no verifications of file size\n"
01107 "       -o oplen: the upper bound on operation size (default 65536)\n"
01108 "       -p progressinterval: debug output at specified operation interval\n"
01109 "       -q: quieter operation\n"
01110 "       -r readbdy: 4096 would make reads page aligned (default 1)\n"
01111 "       -s style: 1 gives smaller truncates (default 0)\n"
01112 "       -t truncbdy: 4096 would make truncates page aligned (default 1)\n"
01113 "       -w writebdy: 4096 would make writes page aligned (default 1)\n"
01114 "       -D startingop: debug output starting at specified operation\n"
01115 "       -L: fsxLite - no file creations & no file size changes\n"
01116 "       -N numops: total # operations to do (default infinity)\n"
01117 "       -O: use oplen (see -o flag) for every op (default random)\n"
01118 "       -P: save .fsxlog and .fsxgood files in dirpath (default ./)\n"
01119 "       -S seed: for random # generator (default 1) 0 gets timestamp\n"
01120 "       -W: mapped write operations DISabled\n"
01121 "        -R: read() system calls only (mapped reads disabled)\n"
01122 "       -I: When multiple paths to the file are given each operation uses"
01123 "           a different path.  Iterate through them in order with 'rotate'"
01124 "           or chose then at 'random'.  (defaults to random)\n"
01125 "       fname: this filename is REQUIRED (no default)\n");
01126         exit(90);
01127 }
01128 
01129 
01130 int
01131 getnum(char *s, char **e)
01132 {
01133         int ret = -1;
01134 
01135         *e = (char *) 0;
01136         ret = strtol(s, e, 0);
01137         if (*e)
01138                 switch (**e) {
01139                 case 'b':
01140                 case 'B':
01141                         ret *= 512;
01142                         *e = *e + 1;
01143                         break;
01144                 case 'k':
01145                 case 'K':
01146                         ret *= 1024;
01147                         *e = *e + 1;
01148                         break;
01149                 case 'm':
01150                 case 'M':
01151                         ret *= 1024*1024;
01152                         *e = *e + 1;
01153                         break;
01154                 case 'w':
01155                 case 'W':
01156                         ret *= 4;
01157                         *e = *e + 1;
01158                         break;
01159                 }
01160         return (ret);
01161 }
01162 
01163 int
01164 main(int argc, char **argv)
01165 {
01166         int     i, style, ch;
01167         char    *endp;
01168         int  dirpath = 0;
01169 
01170         goodfile[0] = 0;
01171         logfile[0] = 0;
01172 
01173         page_size = getpagesize();
01174         page_mask = page_size - 1;
01175 
01176         setvbuf(stdout, (char *)0, _IOLBF, 0); /* line buffered stdout */
01177 
01178         while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv,
01179                                 "b:c:dl:m:no:p:qr:s:t:w:D:I:LN:OP:RS:W"))
01180                != EOF)
01181                 switch (ch) {
01182                 case 'b':
01183                         simulatedopcount = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01184                         if (!quiet)
01185                                 fprintf(stdout, "Will begin at operation"
01186                                         "%ld\n",
01187                                         simulatedopcount);
01188                         if (simulatedopcount == 0)
01189                                 usage();
01190                         simulatedopcount -= 1;
01191                         break;
01192                 case 'c':
01193                         closeprob = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01194                         if (!quiet)
01195                                 fprintf(stdout,
01196                                         "Chance of close/open is 1 in %d\n",
01197                                         closeprob);
01198                         if (closeprob <= 0)
01199                                 usage();
01200                         break;
01201                 case 'd':
01202                         debug++;
01203                         break;
01204                 case 'l':
01205                         maxfilelen = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01206                         if (maxfilelen <= 0)
01207                                 usage();
01208                         break;
01209                 case 'm':
01210                         monitorstart = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01211                         if (monitorstart < 0)
01212                                 usage();
01213                         if (!endp || *endp++ != ':')
01214                                 usage();
01215                         monitorend = getnum(endp, &endp);
01216                         if (monitorend < 0)
01217                                 usage();
01218                         if (monitorend == 0)
01219                                 monitorend = -1; /* aka infinity */
01220                         debug = 1;
01221                 case 'n':
01222                         sizechecks = 0;
01223                         break;
01224                 case 'o':
01225                         maxoplen = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01226                         if (maxoplen <= 0)
01227                                 usage();
01228                         break;
01229                 case 'p':
01230                         progressinterval = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01231                         if (progressinterval < 0)
01232                                 usage();
01233                         break;
01234                 case 'q':
01235                         quiet = 1;
01236                         break;
01237                 case 'r':
01238                         readbdy = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01239                         if (readbdy <= 0)
01240                                 usage();
01241                         break;
01242                 case 's':
01243                         style = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01244                         if (style < 0 || style > 1)
01245                                 usage();
01246                         break;
01247                 case 't':
01248                         truncbdy = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01249                         if (truncbdy <= 0)
01250                                 usage();
01251                         break;
01252                 case 'w':
01253                         writebdy = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01254                         if (writebdy <= 0)
01255                                 usage();
01256                         break;
01257                 case 'D':
01258                         debugstart = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01259                         if (debugstart < 1)
01260                                 usage();
01261                         break;
01262                 case 'I':
01263                         assign_fd_policy(optarg);
01264                         break;
01265                 case 'L':
01266                         lite = 1;
01267                         break;
01268                 case 'N':
01269                         numops = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01270                         if (numops < 0)
01271                                 usage();
01272                         break;
01273                 case 'O':
01274                         randomoplen = 0;
01275                         break;
01276                 case 'P':
01277                         strncpy(goodfile, optarg, sizeof(goodfile));
01278                         strcat(goodfile, "/");
01279                         strncpy(logfile, optarg, sizeof(logfile));
01280                         strcat(logfile, "/");
01281                         dirpath = 1;
01282                         break;
01283                 case 'R':
01284                         mapped_reads = 0;
01285                         break;
01286                 case 'S':
01287                         seed = getnum(optarg, &endp);
01288                         if (seed == 0)
01289                                 seed = time(0) % 10000;
01290                         if (!quiet)
01291                                 fprintf(stdout, "Seed set to %d\n", seed);
01292                         if (seed < 0)
01293                                 usage();
01294                         break;
01295                 case 'W':
01296                         mapped_writes = 0;
01297                         if (!quiet)
01298                                 fprintf(stdout, "mapped writes DISABLED\n");
01299                         break;
01300 
01301                 default:
01302                         usage();
01303                         /* NOTREACHED */
01304                 }
01305         argc -= optind;
01306         argv += optind;
01307         if (argc < 1)
01308                 usage();
01309         fname = argv[0];
01310 
01311         signal(SIGHUP,  cleanup);
01312         signal(SIGINT,  cleanup);
01313         signal(SIGPIPE, cleanup);
01314         signal(SIGALRM, cleanup);
01315         signal(SIGTERM, cleanup);
01316         signal(SIGXCPU, cleanup);
01317         signal(SIGXFSZ, cleanup);
01318         signal(SIGVTALRM,       cleanup);
01319         signal(SIGUSR1, cleanup);
01320         signal(SIGUSR2, cleanup);
01321 
01322         initstate(seed, state, 256);
01323         setstate(state);
01324 
01325         open_test_files(argv, argc);
01326 
01327         strncat(goodfile, dirpath ? my_basename(fname) : fname, 256);
01328         strcat (goodfile, ".fsxgood");
01329         fsxgoodfd = open(goodfile, O_RDWR|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC, 0666);
01330         if (fsxgoodfd < 0) {
01331                 prterr(goodfile);
01332                 exit(92);
01333         }
01334         strncat(logfile, dirpath ? my_basename(fname) : fname, 256);
01335         strcat (logfile, ".fsxlog");
01336         fsxlogf = fopen(logfile, "w");
01337         if (fsxlogf == NULL) {
01338                 prterr(logfile);
01339                 exit(93);
01340         }
01341         if (lite) {
01342                 off_t ret;
01343                 int fd = get_fd();
01344                 file_size = maxfilelen = lseek(fd, (off_t)0, SEEK_END);
01345                 if (file_size == (off_t)-1) {
01346                         prterr(fname);
01347                         warn("main: lseek eof");
01348                         exit(94);
01349                 }
01350                 ret = lseek(fd, (off_t)0, SEEK_SET);
01351                 if (ret == (off_t)-1) {
01352                         prterr(fname);
01353                         warn("main: lseek 0");
01354                         exit(95);
01355                 }
01356         }
01357         original_buf = (char *) malloc(maxfilelen);
01358         for (i = 0; i < maxfilelen; i++)
01359                 original_buf[i] = random() % 256;
01360         good_buf = (char *) malloc(maxfilelen);
01361         memset(good_buf, '\0', maxfilelen);
01362         temp_buf = (char *) malloc(maxoplen);
01363         memset(temp_buf, '\0', maxoplen);
01364         if (lite) {     /* zero entire existing file */
01365                 ssize_t written;
01366                 int fd = get_fd();
01367 
01368                 written = write(fd, good_buf, (size_t)maxfilelen);
01369                 if (written != maxfilelen) {
01370                         if (written == -1) {
01371                                 prterr(fname);
01372                                 warn("main: error on write");
01373                         } else
01374                                 warn("main: short write, 0x%x bytes instead"
01375                                         "of 0x%x\n",
01376                                      (unsigned)written, maxfilelen);
01377                         exit(98);
01378                 }
01379         } else
01380                 check_trunc_hack();
01381 
01382         while (numops == -1 || numops--)
01383                 test();
01384 
01385         close_test_files();
01386         prt("All operations completed A-OK!\n");
01387 
01388         exit(0);
01389         return 0;
01390 }
